About Netskope
Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security. 
Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Seattle, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events (pre and hopefully post-Covid) and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive.  Visit us at Netskope Careers and follow us on Twitter @Netskope and Facebook. 
As a Capacity Manager in Platform Engineering you will partner with cross-functional teams to ensure on time delivery of capacity requests. This role requires you to be an expert multi-tasker, a master planner, and a flexible thinker who can balance multiple objectives and teams in multiple locations with a smile. In addition, you will provide capacity related process leadership by sharing best practices and technology trends, and acting as a mentor related to their area(s) of expertise.
Essential Functions:  

Embrace our corporate culture by fostering collaboration without boundaries, encouraging teamwork and communication that is clear, open, and honest.
Own and drive a higher level of SLA achievement within the cross functional Capacity Management Team. 
Monitor the SLA metrics closely (Response, Update Frequencies, Time in Status and Required Date), develop SLA reports and standard reporting cadence.
Evaluate, approve, and or deny Capacity Requests against available and forecasted capacity.
Estable multi-quarter capacity forecast that accounts for organic and inorganic growth
Continue to help refine the Capacity Process to meet the SLA metrics effectively
Develop and streamline a process to drive requests to closure in a timely manner
Coordinate efforts with key stakeholders both internally and externally
Manage the end to end delivery of large or complex capacity adds and ensure they are closely tracked and continuously develop process improvements to minimize risk.
Reducing the overall volume of escalations by driving follow-up discussions to determine actions/improvements to prevent future escalations

Required Experience:  

Demonstrated understanding of computer and system architectures along with an understanding of how software can consume system capacity.
Experience coordinating and directing matrixed teams and resources.
Experience with hardware and asset lifecycle management.
Exposure to public and private cloud based solutions and architectures.
Experience with Agile Development processes.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Hands on experience collaborating with overseas teams.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Desired Experience:

Proven ability to multitask, analyze opportunities, define successful approaches, and proactively solve problems.  
Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of  management.  
Established track record for providing valuable details to developers and engineers.
Established track record for providing valuable feedback during planning and implementation of existing projects.
Demonstrated passion, commitment to product excellence, and practical sense of how to get it done.
Thrives in an environment of ambiguity and creates order out of it.  
Motivated get-it-done attitude, friendly and inclusive attitude.  
Knowledge of enterprise networking and security technologies.

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or combination of comparable education and experience typically obtained by 5 or more years related work experience.​
